intro: Penstemon pseudospectabilis, commonly known as the Rocky Mountain beardtongue, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically produces clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Penstemon pseudospectabilis is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
